West Grove, PA is a small suburb in Southern Chester County with an estimated population of 2,781 residents. Although this town is known for its country charm, it has seen a lot of development throughout the past decade.  Its farmland has gradually been turning into new neighborhoods and shopping centers.
If you are traveling long distance,
is approximately a 50 minute drive from West Grove. Rental cars and taxis (215-937-6958) are available to help you travel from the airport to West Grove. Also,

has a Wilmington/Newark Line that runs from Delaware to Philadelphia. The Newark train station is approximately a 25-30 minute drive from West Grove. A car or taxi (610-384-2900) can also be used to get to West Grove.
A car is the most practical way to travel throughout West Grove. Some distances are short enough that you are able to walk or bike to since it is a very small town.

: The property that The Red Rose Inn sits on was once owned by William Penn. He sublet this property to a family member and in 1740 the inn was built.  It served as a place for commerce and for travelers to eat, rest, and catch up on the latest news. In the 1980’s, the inn was turned into a restaurant and rumors arose that this building is haunted.  Restaurant staff and patrons told stories of seeing various ghosts and mysterious occurrences. Located at 804 W Baltimore Pike West Grove, PA 19390.

: Although not in West Grove, Longwood Gardens is worth the 25 minute drive. It features beautiful gardens, events and performances, and family fun. Located at 1001 Longwood Road, Kennett Square, PA 19348 (610)-388-1000.

: The market opens May 7th and goes until mid-October.  It is open every Thursday from 2-6 pm at Harmony Park. Locally produced vegetables, fruits, herbs, cut flowers, mushrooms, plants, honey, jams and jellies, baked goods, chicken and eggs can be found at this market. Located at 294 West Harmony Road, West Grove, PA 19390.

: Boomers is made for both children and adults to enjoy.  There is a driving range, mini golf course, ice skating rink, laser tag, arcade games, sport court, bounce zone, and much more! Located at 1056 Gap Newport Pike, Avondale, PA (610)-268-5678.

: A local and quaint winery that is the perfect location for special events. You can rent the tasting room for small parties of up to 40 people. If you are looking to host a larger party of up to 350 people, you can reserve a tent on the vineyard. This is ideal for weddings, family reunions, or anniversaries. Located at 553 S.
